Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui

Interface Page

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPage
    public interface Page
extends java.io.Serializable

    A Page object represents a single part of a Tabris UI. A Tabris UI consists of several Page objects. Usually a Page takes the most of the device's screen. The responsibility of a Page is to display the application content. Basically it's the only area where you will create widgets and other visual representations.

    Page implementations will be registered by their type. This is because a page object needs to be created newly when it's shown the first time. Let's take a look at an example:

    When you create a book browsing app you will probably have a book page. In this app you will need to browse through books, right? And the big feature will be that you can browse from book to book in a chain. So, as a result a new book page needs to be created for every new book. But when you want to browse back to the last book it doesn't need a new page object because it already exist. And this is exactly how the Tabris UI works.

    NOTE: A Page needs to provide a no-argument constructor because instances will be created by the framework.

    Usually this interface will not be implemented directly. Mostly an AbstractPage can be used which provides methods for handling the UI.

    Since:
    0.11
    See Also:
    PageConfiguration, AbstractPage

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void activate()
      Will be called every time the page will be activated regardless if the user browses forward or backward.
      void createContent​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent, UI ui)
      Will be called by the Tabris UI during the instantiation of a Page.
      void deactivate()
      Will be called every time the page will be deactivated regardless if the user browses forward or backward.
      void destroy()
      Will be called when the page will be destroyed.

    • Method Detail

      • createContent

        void createContent​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                   UI ui)

        Will be called by the Tabris UI during the instantiation of a Page. Within this method the UI code should be created.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to use for creating SWT widgets.
        ui - the ui to control the application flow and share data.
        Since:
        1.0

      • activate

        void activate()

        Will be called every time the page will be activated regardless if the user browses forward or backward.

        void deactivate()

        Will be called every time the page will be deactivated regardless if the user browses forward or backward.

        Since:
        1.0

      • destroy

        void destroy()

        Will be called when the page will be destroyed.

        Since:
        1.2
